instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Arrived powering on with chime but no backlght. Liquid damaged. Replaced everything affected by the spill. Turned on with backlight for a few seconds but then turned off stuck at 0.268 amps. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now 1.5V and shorted 0.001 diode mode.

Injected voltage into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> but nothing is getting hot.

What to check next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
You've just fried the CPU.
After lot of times mentioned how to NOT inject voltage there :(.

Post exact ohm values on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all big coils.
I suspect an high-side MOSFET shorted on CPU power supply; worst scenario.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> at the same time which solved that issue and it now turns on.

New problem now is fast fan spin and running slow. Ran full ASD EFI and surprisingly it passed. Replaced Q75660 and all values are good on <RESISTOR>R5665</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5660</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5661</RESISTOR>.

What to check next???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Install HWMonitor and check sor any strange temp value.
Test disconnecting camera and also try known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message: This is what I get on HW monitor but not sure how to reference it to the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Strange to have temp errors on both SMC SMBus 1 and 2 at same time.
Did you try known good trackpad board and cable?

Be sure <RESISTOR>R5260</RESISTOR>/61 and <RESISTOR>R5270</RESISTOR>/71 are good.
Inspect <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> area for corrosion.
Check its traces to <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>/15/20.
Post diode mode on its SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
yes known good trackpad and cable are being used.

<RESISTOR>R5260</RESISTOR> 4.7k <RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR> 4.7k

<CHIP>U5511</CHIP> area perfect condition with no corrosion.

Traces to <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>/15/20 are good

diode SCL .507  SDA .507

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Check diode mode and voltage at SCL/SDA lines on both SMBus 1 & 2.
Change <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
diode mode on SCL/SDA 0.524 and voltage 3.4V on both.

changed <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> but no change

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Could be PCH internal problem.

Worth to try clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
Used last link in this post for the clean ME and changed serial to my own before programming. Still no change. Bad PCH??

[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/39737-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-need-clean-me-spi-rom[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short
threads.message:
PCH, or maybe SMC.
You can try changing SMC.
Reball it first...
